title: Hiearchy
text: Each item must be assigned a Hierarchy. [Often referred to as Departments or Categories]. Select an existing one or create a new one. Select a Hierarchy from the available list. The Root Node [Top Level] Hierarchy is shown first. Use the side arrow [1] to show the Sub Node options [Categories]. [2] Once selected, Next to move to the next step. [5] If the Hierarchy is not available, you can create a new Root Node using the Create a New Root Node option. [3] or a Sub Node using the Plus Sign to the right of the Root Node. [4]. See Item Hierarchies for further details if required.
description:

Select a Hierarchy from the available list. 

The Root Node [Top Level] Hierarchy is shown first. Use the side arrow [1] to show the Sub Node options [Categories]. [2]

Once selected, Next to move to the next step. [5]

If the Hierarchy is not available, you can create a new Root Node using the Create a New Root Node option. [3] or a Sub Node using the Plus Sign to the right of the Root Node. [4]. See Item Hierarchies for further details if required.

title: Details
text: This is where you add all the main information about the item you are creating. Complete each field as required, then Next to move to the next step. NOTE: If creating an item with variants, some variants may have slightly different information, however, enter the most common value, then change as required in Step 6 – Variants. e.g., Vendor Item Number per colour, variant item number, and price per size. NOTE: (*) Indicates a Mandatory field. Name* This is the Master Item Name. Used by the Item List and parts of Imagine where the items are listed at the Master Item level instead of variant level [Colour and Size]. Master Item Number The number or code by which the master item will be known or referenced. It will appear in most lists and reports where the master item is listed. NOTE: If left blank, it will automatically generate one for you. Manufacturer Item Number If required, the Manufacturer number or code by which the master item will be known or referenced. Vendor Item Number If required the Vendor number or code by which the master item will be known or referenced. Description This field is an extended description of the Name field and is commonly used to hold more descriptive information about a product. It can include material type, weight, size, artist information, design notes, etc. Type* Stocked: This is where there is physical stock to count and manage. Non-Stock: This is where there is no stock to count or manage, such as postage, service, or repair fees. Serialized: This is when you want to keep individual instances of a particular item when they are received, transferred, sold, or returned. This helps with keeping track of item warranties and high-value goods. NOTE: For this option, it will need to be activated via the Portal>Configuration>Tenant Tab. Vendor* This is who supplies the item, sometimes referred to as the Supplier. Select an existing Vendor from the list. If no Vendor exists, use the Manage Vendors button to create a new Vendor. NOTE: Only the Vendor Name and Vendor Code are created. All other Vendor details should be added in the Back-Office – Vendors section. Sales UOM Code UOM is a Unit of Measure by which an item is sold. This could be weight, length, pack size, or something else. Currently, this field is for reference purposes only. Tax Rate This is the Tax Rate to be applied when the item is sold. If there are multiple Tax Groups, select a Tax Rate from each as required. Only 1 tax rate can be chosen from each group. Default Label Template This is the label format which will be used for label printing unless an alternative format is selected at the time of printing. For more information, see Label Templates. Restock Level This is the maximum amount of stock to hold for the variant item. Currently, this field is for reference purposes only. Reorder Point This is the lowest amount of stock to be held for an item. It indicates when an item requires ordering again. Reorder Number If required the Reorder number or code by which the master item will be known or referenced. POS Block Discount When set to YES, the item is blocked from being discounted at the POS. The default setting is NO – Item can be discounted. POS Prompt for Price When set to YES, a prompt appears at the POS asking the user to enter a price. The default setting is NO – The item is not prompted for a price. POS Block Quantity Entry When set to YES, the user cannot change the quantity of the item being sold. The default setting is NO – A quantity can be set against the item.

title: Local Prices
text: Here you enter the cost and selling price of the item, Cost Price The cost price of the item. The cost of an item can be altered at a later stage, either directly or by receiving in goods. At each transaction, the current cost of the item is recorded as it is sold or returned. This ensures an accurate profit margin can be maintained. Costs are recorded by shop in case of regional differences in tax or shipping cost. Retail Price The retail price of the item. Estimated Margins Displays each Tax Rate and Estimated Margin. Exchange Rate Price If you have shops with different currencies, then Imagine will automatically calculate the price for these based on the current exchange rate. You can override these by unticking the exchange rate price and manually entering the price in the entered Sales Price.

title: Attributes
text: Here you enter the Required and Optional Custom attributes are shown based on your Custom Attribute. Required Attributes (*) - Enter the information against all required attributes. Optional Attributes - Use the select drop-down menu to select an optional Attribute. To remove any optional Attributes click the bin icon to delete. To create a new attribute click on 'Create an Attribute' this will then give you a pop-up. Fill in the information required and press save. NOTE: Depending if this item needs to be Required or Optional tick the box. OFF - This item will be Optional and you can select it in the drop-down menu. ON - This item will be required and will be shown in the Required Attributes list.
description:

Required Attributes (*) - Enter the information against all required attributes.

Optional Attributes - Use the select drop-down menu to select an optional Attribute. 

To remove any optional Attributes click the bin icon to delete.


To create a new attribute click on 'Create an Attribute' this will then give you a pop-up.

Fill in the information required and press save. 

NOTE: Depending if this item needs to be Required or Optional tick the box.

OFF - This item will be Optional and you can select it in the drop-down menu.

ON - This item will be required and will be shown in the Required Attributes list.

title: Dimensions
text: This is where you choose if an item has variants. [Colour, Size, Fit, Width] or just a standard item. For Standard items leave the Number of Dimensions set as 0 and move to the next step. For Variant items Choose Number of Dimensions: Move the slider to the required number of Dimensions the maximum you can choose is 10. NOTE: Whilst there are no strict rules on Dimensions, it is recommended to be consistent where Dimension 1 is the Colour, Dimension 2 is the Size, Dimension 3 is the width/fit etc. A dimension panel will appear for however many you have selected. Here you can set up the Dimension from a pre-defined template or setup using the custom option. If you already have Pre-Defined Templates you can use the Drop down to select a Template and Dimension values which have already been created into groups of colours, sizes, widths or other values. Dimension values can be reordered by clicking on the group of 6 dots and dragging up and down the list. Dimension values can be removed by unticking the selection [2]. Dimension values can be added by choosing the PLUS option [3]. Just key in a new value when prompted. Custom - Custom Dimensions are not saved, they are only to create the current item. Enter a relevant Dimension name. Use the option to key in a new value when prompted. Dimension values can be reordered by clicking on the group of 6 dots and dragging up and down the list. Dimension values can be removed by unticking the selection. Repeat for All Dimensions required then Next to move to the next step. Completed example of 2 Dimensions using Colour [as a Custom selection] and Size [as a template selection].

title: Variants
text: A list of variants is shown based on the selections from the previous steps. Here you can check and change the details of each variant before they are saved. Each variant may have specific requirements, such as a custom item number or a manufacturer's barcode. Additionally, different colour variants might have distinct manufacturer or vendor numbers. There could also be varying prices for certain sizes, and the extended description may differ between different colour variants. To modify any of the fields displayed on the screen, simply click on the relevant field and make the necessary changes. Click on the Edit Pencil icon for each variant to access additional editable fields [2]. Variant Item Number - If left empty, Imagine will automatically assign a number to each variant. Barcodes - If left empty, Imagine will automatically generate an internal barcode for each variant. Save - Remember to select Save on this page to preserve any changes made to individual variants. Fields indicated by the pencil symbol can be modified. Clicking on it will open a new window, allowing you to review and edit any previously entered information. SAVE - Finally clicking Save will create your new item and on successfully creating a green prompt confirming “Item was created successfully” will appear before returning to step 1 of the wizard. It will take a few moments for your item to be created. Once completed the below notification will show.
